clinical_study.brief_title: Dental Erosion in Patients With Gastro-oesophageal Reflux
clinical_study.official_title: Dental Erosion in Patients With Gastro-oesophageal Reflux

brief_summary.textblock:
Not only caries but also exposure to acids can lead to loss of tooth structure. This acid-related tooth structure loss is defined as dental erosion.
A relationship between dental erosion and occurence of reflux disease was shown in numerous studies. On the one hand, patients with dental erosions frequently show reflux disease. On the other hand, many - but not all - reflux patients show dental erosions. It is believed that certain salivary parameters might explain, why not all reflux patients alike are affected of dental erosions.
The aim of this study is to analyze the relationship and the extent of occurrence of dental erosions and reflux symptoms, including investigation of certain salivary parameters.

primary_outcome.measure: Visual assessment of the BEWE-(basic erosive wear examination)-index
primary_outcome.time_frame: After removal of the probe (on second day)

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of unstimulated and stimulated saliva flow rate (ml/min).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: While wearing the probe at three time points over 24h: morning, noon, evening

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of saliva pH and buffer capacity (mol/L).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: While wearing the probe at three time points over 24h: morning, noon, evening

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of total protein content in saliva (g/L).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: While wearing the probe at three time points over 24h: morning, noon, evening

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination inorganic calcium and phosphate in saliva (mmol/L).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: While wearing the probe at three time points over 24h: morning, noon, evening

secondary_outcome.measure: Measurement of salivary enzyme activity: Protease, Kollagenase/Gelatinase, Pepsin, Trypsin, and Amylase (U/mL).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: While wearing the probe at three time points over 24h: morning, noon, evening

arm_group.description: Patients who are treated at the Clinic for Gastroenterology and Gastrointestinal Oncology and have a 24-hours pH monitoring or impedance measurement performed for medical reasons

biospec_descr.textblock: Saliva samples are obtained and retained for 10 years.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are treated at the Clinic for Gastroenterology and Gastrointestinal Oncology and have a 24-hours pH monitoring or impedance measurement performed for medical reasons
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to give written consent
- Age <18 years
- Intake of proton pump inhibitors (PPIs) if they are not discontinued at least one week before study participation
